guttmanlab.core.annotationcollection

Interface AnnotationCollection<T extends Annotation>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAnnotationCollection, BAMPairedFragmentCollection, BAMPairedFragmentCollection.SpecialBAMPECollection, BAMSingleReadCollection, ConvertedSpace, FeatureCollection

    public interface AnnotationCollection<T extends Annotation>
    A container of annotations
    Author:
    prussell

    • Method Detail

      • merge

        AnnotationCollection<T> merge()
        Merge the annotations in this collection
        Returns:
        A new annotation collection consisting of the merged annotations

      • overlaps

        boolean overlaps(Annotation other)
        Parameters:
        other - An annotation
        Returns:
        True iff the annotation overlaps some annotation in this collection

      • numOverlappers

        int numOverlappers(Annotation region,
                 boolean fullyContained)
        Get the number of annotations in this collection that overlap the region
        Parameters:
        region - Region to check for overlappers
        fullyContained - Whether the overlappers must be fully contained in the region in order to count
        Returns:
        The number of overlappers

      • sortedIterator

        net.sf.samtools.util.CloseableIterator<T> sortedIterator()
        Returns:
        A sorted iterator over all the annotations in this collection

      • sortedIterator

        net.sf.samtools.util.CloseableIterator<T> sortedIterator(Annotation region,
                                                       boolean fullyContained)
        A sorted iterator over the set of annotations in this collection that overlap the region (must be sorted)
        Parameters:
        region - Region to check for overlappers
        fullyContained - Whether the overlappers must be fully contained in the region
        Returns:
        Iterator over the set of overlappers

      • addFilter

        void addFilter(org.apache.commons.collections15.Predicate<T> filter)
        Add a filter that will be applied when getting subsets or iterators
        Parameters:
        filter - A predicate that is true if the annotation passes the filter (should be kept)

      • getFilters

        java.util.Collection<org.apache.commons.collections15.Predicate<T>> getFilters()
        Get all the filters passed to this class
        Returns:
        A collection of all predicate filters

      • writeToBAM

        void writeToBAM(java.lang.String fileName)
        Write the collection of annotations (using filters) to a file
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file to write to

      • writeToBAM

        void writeToBAM(java.lang.String fileName,
              Annotation region,
              boolean fullyContained)
        Write the reads overlapping this region to a file
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file to write to
        region - The region to overlap
        fullyContained - whether to use only reads fully contained in this region (true) or merely overlapping (false)

      • getReferenceCoordinateSpace

        CoordinateSpace getReferenceCoordinateSpace()
        Returns:
        The reference coordinate space

      • getFeatureCoordinateSpace

        CoordinateSpace getFeatureCoordinateSpace()
        Returns:
        The feature coordinate space

      • convertCoordinates

        <X extends Annotation> AnnotationCollection<DerivedAnnotation<X>> convertCoordinates(AnnotationCollection<X> readCollection,
                                                                                   CoordinateSpace referenceSpaceForAnnotations,
                                                                                   boolean fullyContained)
        TODO Consider returning an AnnotationCollection Convert the annotation from the reference space If the reference equals the reference of the FeatureSpace it will return feature space If the reference equals the feature in the FeatureSpace it will return reference space If the reference doesn't equal either, it will throw an Exception
        Parameters:
        annotations - An iterator of the annotations to convert
        referenceSpaceForAnnotations - The reference coordinate space of the annotation to map (must match either reference or feature space)
        fullyContained - whether to only convert a fragment if it is fully within the feature (true) or return the trimmed partial (false)
        Returns:
        An iterator of annotations in the new feature space (A window object but really can be anything with hasParent())

      • getPopulatedWindows

        net.sf.samtools.util.CloseableIterator<? extends PopulatedWindow<T>> getPopulatedWindows(Annotation region,
                                                                                       int windowLength)
        Get an iterator over all populated windows of size widowLength overlapping a region
        Parameters:
        region - The region to scan
        windowLength - The length of the window
        Returns:
        Iterator of windows and all of their overlapping reads of type T

      • getPopulatedWindows

        net.sf.samtools.util.CloseableIterator<? extends PopulatedWindow<T>> getPopulatedWindows(Annotation region,
                                                                                       int windowLength,
                                                                                       int stepSize)
        Get an iterator over all populated windows of size widowLength overlapping a region
        Parameters:
        region - The region to scan
        windowLength - The length of the window
        stepSize - Step size
        Returns:
        Iterator of windows and all of their overlapping reads of type T

      • getPopulatedWindows

        net.sf.samtools.util.CloseableIterator<? extends PopulatedWindow<T>> getPopulatedWindows(Annotation region,
                                                                                       int windowLength,
                                                                                       int stepSize,
                                                                                       boolean includeEmpties)
        Get an iterator over all populated windows of size widowLength overlapping a region
        Parameters:
        region - The region to scan
        windowLength - The length of the window
        stepSize - Step size
        includeEmpties - Also return windows with zero overlappers
        Returns:
        Iterator of windows and all of their overlapping reads of type T

      • getNumAnnotations

        int getNumAnnotations()
        Iterates through the annotations in sortedIterator()

        the number of annotations in the collection
